page.title: 11Tourism Crosthwaite 'area'
page.content: {Lambhowe Caravan Park}provides a 26 acre site for 112 privately owned caravans which can be occupied from March to October. The caravans have electriciy which also provides street lighting on site.Nowhere else in the area has this facility. Cooking is by Calor Gas; flush toilets are in most vans; a public telephone box is available and milk and eggs are sold. All visitors bring most of their own provisions from their own local supermarkets but do make some use of the two local stores in Crosthwaite Village and at Bowland Bridge. There is a bar on site with a room for children. The site is advertised but after 11 yrs. it has built up its own reputation. The woodland setting provides animal interest - red squirrels, foxes, deer, and rabbits - which town visitors find fascinating.
